content.description: A fun route with an interesting few moves to the first bolt. Take a single rack for the middle section. Then 2 more bolts at the top for the crux that is right before the anchors.
content.location: On the right end of the cliff. From the steps on the right go left about 50 feet and you will see the first bolt.

content.description: Climb up the right face of the corner to the right of the collapsed pillar in the middle.  When we climbed this it was very sandy and muddy but hopefully will clean up as time goes on.  Look out for crumbling rock on the pillar.
content.location: On the right face of a large corner with a collapsed pillar of rock leaning into it.  Located to the left of the climb 'Rain Dancer', closer to the down stream trail head.

climbs.name: Sweet Leaf
climbs.fa: Tyrel Johnson and Michael Gray, August 2017

content.location: The first line of bolts as you come from the upstream trail head

content.description: Dihedral up and passed/around an overhang.
Start by climbing up the fallen boulder to the right of the cave, run up on jugs and good holds to the anchors sitting just below the roof. You might need to share some moves with the route next door
content.location: 40 feet left of Ugly duckling corner/Raindancer arete, start by climbing up the large boulder right of a cave

content.description: Cool airy face climbing through the middle of the route, sandwiched between cruxy side pull section at the base and guarding the anchors.
content.protection: Bolts and chain anchors with biners
content.location: Around the arete, just right of Ugly Duckling

content.description: Start in the mossy corner and climb up onto a ledge.  Switch to the right face, pull the roof, clip a bolt, and then climb the last few feet to the anchors.  The roof pull is the crux and feels well protected. The route is vegetated down low but cleaner up above.
content.protection: Seven bolts and quick links at the top.
content.location: This climb is to the right of and around the corner from Colors of the Fall.  It is on the left side of a featured corner.

content.description: Go around the roof ~6' up to get to the 1st bolt, then face climb and up through the roof up high.
Just to the right of River Song.
Face climb up through a large roof.

Start on the face left of the Ugly Duckling corner, under the crack/seam that leads to the first bolt. Pull difficult moves at the bottom followed by good holds and good times up to the roof. Get those feet high and pulldown on more good holds through the cute miniroof to access the chains.
content.location: find the crack/seam left of Ugly Duckling corner/Raindancer arete.

content.description: The left line of the two routes starting under a large roof, this one traverses left under the roof before going up to the anchors.
content.location: The next set of bolted routes after you pass Castles Made Of Sand coming from the upstream trail head, look for a pedestal in a corner under a large roof.

climbs.name: Daytrippers
climbs.fa: TR FA Michael and Cindy Gray, Bolts and Lead FA Mike Gray and Tyrel Johnson, July 2018

content.description: Shares anchors with the climb to the right, this is a harder alternate start to 'Castles Made of Sand' that joins up with it after the ledge.
content.location: The middle bolted line at the first rock face from the upstream trail.

content.description: This route traverses right under the large roof before pulling into an awkward chimney/open book.
content.location: The next set of bolted routes after you pass Castles Made Of Sand coming from the upstream trail head, look for a pedestal in a corner under a large roof, this is the line on the right.

content.description: Climb up the face on the right to a big ledge then reach around a corner to gain the anchors.
content.location: The right most line of bolts on the first rock face from the upstream trail head, this climb shares anchors with the line to the left.

content.description:
Climb past three bolts on the tricky technical face to the obvious horizontal finger crack. Really fun boulder problem! The gear is awesome... do it!

Thanks to Mike Gray for the assistance while bolting this rig!
content.protection: Three bolts to bomber finger sized gear. A #1 for the exit is helpful. Two-bolt anchor
content.location: Right of Raindancer on the right end of the Social Platform
